revised_title: A Comparative Study of Skull Development in Urodelous Amphibia and Batrachian Amphibia
tldr: This study compares the development of the skull in Urodelous and Batrachian Amphibia, providing insights into their morphological differences and evolutionary relationships. The author examines the structure and development of the skull in various stages, focusing on the Axolotl (Siredon) and Amblystoma, and discusses the role of the notochord in cranial morphology.
